snippet: Murong Xuecun, a frequent critic of the Communist Party, had said he was expecting a visit from the police after several of his friends were detained.
abstract: Beijing police detain and later release Hao Qun, prominent Chinese writer and frequent critic of the Communist Party who goes by the pen name Murong Xuecun, in relation to May 3 gathering he attended to commemorate the 1989 Tiananmen Square pro-democracy protests.
lead_paragraph: Murong Xuecun, a frequent critic of the Communist Party, had said he was expecting a visit from the police after several of his friends were detained.

headline.main: Author Held in Beijing After a Spate of Detentions
headline.print_headline: Author Held in Beijing After a Spate of Detentions
